summary.long: John is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The Word (Christ) was in the beginning. The Word was with God. The Word was God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was with God in the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made all things. Nothing was made without Him making it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Life began by Him. His Life was the Light for men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Light shines in the darkness. The darkness has never been able to put out the Light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man sent from God whose name was John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to tell what he knew about the Light so that all men might believe through him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John was not the Light, but he was sent to tell about the Light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This true Light, coming into the world, gives light to every man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came into the world. The world was made by Him, but it did not know Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to His own, but His own did not receive Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave the right and the power to become children of God to those who received Him. He gave this to those who put their trust in His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These children of God were not born of blood and of flesh and of man’s desires, but they were born of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christ became human flesh and lived among us. We saw His shining-greatness. This greatness is given only to a much-loved Son from His Father. He was full of loving-favor and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John told about Christ and said, “I have been telling you about this One. I said, ‘He is coming after me. He is more important than I because He lived before me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Him Who has so much we have all received loving-favor, one loving-favor after another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Law was given through Moses, but loving-favor and truth came through Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The much-loved Son is beside the Father. No man has ever seen God. But Christ has made God known to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews sent their religious leaders and men from the family group of Levi to ask John, “Who are you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them without holding back any words, “I am not the Christ!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Then who are you? Are you Elijah?” He said, “I am not!” Then they asked, “Are you the special One Who was to come to speak for God?” John said, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they asked him, “Who are you? We must tell those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John said, “I am the voice of one crying in the desert. ‘Make the road straight for the Lord,’ as the early preacher Isaiah said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who had been sent were from the proud religious law-keepers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked John again, “Then why do you baptize if you are not the Christ or Elijah or that special One Who was to come to speak for God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered, “I baptize with water. But there is One standing among you Whom you do not know.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the One Who is coming after me. I am not good enough to get down and help Him take off His shoes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All this happened when John was baptizing in the town of Bethany. He was on the other side of the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day John the Baptist saw Jesus coming to him. He said, “See! The Lamb of God Who takes away the sin of the world!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have been talking about Him. I said, ‘One is coming after me Who is more important than I, because He lived before I was born.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I did not know who He was, but I have come to baptize with water so the Jews might know about Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then John said, “I saw the Holy Spirit come down on Jesus as a dove from heaven. The Holy Spirit stayed on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I did not know Him then. But God sent me to baptize with water. God said to me, ‘The Holy Spirit will come down and stay on Him. He is the One Who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw this happen. I am now saying that Jesus is the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day John the Baptist was standing with two of his own followers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus walked by. John looked at Him and said, “See! The Lamb of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John’s two followers heard him say this and followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus turned around and saw them following. He said to them, “What are you looking for?” They answered, “Teacher, where are you staying?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He said to them, “Come and see.” They followed Him and saw where He lived. They stayed with Him that day. It was about four o’clock in the afternoon.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, was one of the two who had heard John’s words and had followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first thing he did was to find his brother Simon. He said to him, “We have found the Christ!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Andrew took Simon to Jesus. When Jesus saw Simon, He said, “You are Simon, the son of John. Your name will be Cephas.” The name Cephas means Peter, or a rock.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The next day Jesus wanted to go to the country of Galilee. He found Philip and said to him, “Follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Philip was from the town of Bethsaida. Andrew and Peter were from this town also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found the One Moses wrote about in the Law. He is the One the early preachers wrote about. He is Jesus of Nazareth, the Son of Joseph.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nathanael said, “Can anything good come out of the town of Nazareth?” Philip said, “Come and see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to Him and said, “See! There is a true Jew. There is nothing false in him.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nathanael said to Jesus, “How do You know me?” Jesus answered him, “Before Philip talked to you, I saw you under the fig tree.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nathanael said to Him, “Teacher, You are the Son of God. You are the King of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Do you believe because I said I saw you under the fig tree? You will see greater things than that.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, you will see heaven opened and God’s angels going up and coming and down on the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Three days later there was a wedding in the town of Cana in the country of Galilee. The mother of Jesus was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus and His followers were asked to come to the wedding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the wine was all gone, the mother of Jesus said to Him, “They have no more wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, what is that to you and to Me. It is not time for Me to work yet.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: His mother said to the helpers, “Do whatever He says.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six stone water jars were there. Each one held about one-half barrel of water. These water jars were used in the Jewish worship of washing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to the helpers, “Fill the jars with water.” They filled them to the top.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then He said, “Take some out and give it to the head man who is caring for the people.” They took some to him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The head man tasted the water that had become wine. He did not know where it came from but the helpers who took it to him knew. He called the man who had just been married.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The head man said to him, “Everyone puts out his best wine first. After people have had much to drink, he puts out the wine that is not so good. You have kept the good wine until now!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: This was the first powerful work Jesus did. It was done in Cana of Galilee where He showed His power. His followers put their trust in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this He went down to the city of Capernaum. His mother and brothers and followers went with Him. They stayed there a few days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was time for the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went into the house of God and found cattle and sheep and doves being sold. Men were sitting there changing money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus made a whip of small ropes. He used it to make them all leave the house of God along with the sheep and cattle. He pushed their money off the tables and turned the tables over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to those who sold doves, “Take these things out of here! You must not make My Father’s house a place for buying and selling!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then His followers remembered that it was written in the Holy Writings, “I am jealous for the honor of Your house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews asked Him, “What can You do to show us You have the right and the power to do these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “Destroy this house of God and in three days I will build it again.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the Jews said, “It took forty-six years to build this house of God. Will You build it up in three days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was speaking of His body as the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had been raised from the dead, His followers remembered He said this. They believed the Holy Writings and what He had said.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus was in Jerusalem at the time of the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. Many people put their trust in Him when they saw the powerful works He did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus did not trust them because He knew all men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not need anyone to tell Him about man. He knew what was in man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man named Nicodemus. He was a proud religious law-keeper and a leader of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to Jesus at night and said, “Teacher, we know You have come from God to teach us. No one can do these powerful works You do unless God is with Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “For sure, I tell you, unless a man is born again, he cannot see the holy nation of God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nicodemus said to Him, “How can a man be born when he is old? How can he get into his mother’s body and be born the second time?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “For sure, I tell you, unless a man is born of water and of the Spirit of God, he cannot get into the holy nation of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whatever is born of the flesh is flesh. Whatever is born of the Spirit is spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not be surprised that I said to you, ‘You must be born again.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The wind blows where it wants to and you hear its sound. You do not know where it comes from or where it goes. It is the same with everyone who is born of the Spirit of God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nicodemus said to Him, “How can this be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Are you a teacher among the Jews and do not know these things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, We are talking about things We know. We tell of what We have seen. Yet you do not take Our words to be true.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I tell you about things of the earth and you do not believe them. How will you believe if I tell you things about heaven?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “No one has gone up into heaven except the One Who came down from heaven. That One is the Son of Man Who is in heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: As Moses lifted up the snake in the desert, so the Son of Man must be lifted up.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then whoever puts his trust in Him will have life that lasts forever.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For God so loved the world that He gave His only Son. Whoever puts his trust in God’s Son will not be lost but will have life that lasts forever.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For God did not send His Son into the world to say it is guilty. He sent His Son so the world might be saved from the punishment of sin by Him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whoever puts his trust in His Son is not guilty. Whoever does not put his trust in Him is guilty already. It is because he does not put his trust in the name of the only Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “The Light has come into the world. And the Light is the test by which men are guilty or not. People love darkness more than the Light because the things they do are sinful.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Everyone who sins hates the Light. He stays away from the Light because his sin would be found out.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The man who does what is right comes to the Light. What he does will be seen because he has done what God wanted him to do.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: After this, Jesus and His followers came into the country of Judea. He stayed with them there and baptized people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John was baptizing in the town of Aenon near Salim. There was much water there and people were coming to be baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John had not been put in prison yet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the followers of John and a Jew started to argue about the religious washing of the Jewish worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to John and said to him, “Teacher, the One with you on the other side of the Jordan River is baptizing also. He is the One you told of. Everyone is going to Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John said, “A man can receive nothing unless it has been given to him from heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You heard the words that I said, ‘I am not the Christ, but I have been sent before Him.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The man who has just been married has the bride. The friend of the man just married stands at his side and listens to him. He has joy when he hears the voice of the man just married. I am full of this joy.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He must become more important. I must become less important.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “He Who comes from above is above all. He who comes from the earth is of the earth and speaks of the earth. He Who comes from heaven is above all.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He tells of what He has seen and heard. But no one believes what He says.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Whoever receives His words proves that God is true.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He was sent by God and He speaks God’s Word. God gives Him all of His Spirit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The Father loves the Son and has given all things into His hand.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He who puts his trust in the Son has life that lasts forever. He who does not put his trust in the Son will not have life, but the anger of God is on him.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus knew the proud religious law-keepers had heard He was making and baptizing more followers than John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus did not baptize anyone Himself but His followers did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus went from the country of Judea to the country of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had to go through the country of Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He came to a town in Samaria called Sycar. It was near the piece of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob’s well was there. Jesus was tired from traveling so He sat down just as He was by the well. It was about noon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A woman of Samaria came to get water. Jesus said to her, “Give Me a drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His followers had gone to the town to buy food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman of Samaria said to Him, “You are a Jew. I am of Samaria. Why do You ask me for a drink when the Jews have nothing to do with the people of Samaria?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “You do not know what God has to give. You do not know Who said to you, ‘Give Me a drink.’ If you knew, you would have asked Him. He would have given you living water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to Him, “Sir, the well is deep. You have nothing to get water with. Where will You get the living water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are You greater than our early father Jacob? He gave us the well. He and his children and his cattle drank from it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Whoever drinks this water will be thirsty again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever drinks the water that I will give him will never be thirsty. The water that I will give him will become in him a well of life that lasts forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said, “Sir, give me this water so I will never be thirsty. Then I will not have to come all this way for water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Go call your husband and come back.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said, “I have no husband.” Jesus said, “You told the truth when you said, ‘I have no husband.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have had five husbands. The one you have now is not your husband. You told the truth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to Him, “Sir, I think You are a person Who speaks for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our early fathers worshiped on this mountain. You Jews say Jerusalem is the place where men should worship.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe Me. The time is coming when you will not worship the Father on this mountain or in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You people do not know what you worship. We Jews know what we worship. It is through the Jews that men are saved from the punishment of their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The time is coming, yes, it is here now, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and in truth. The Father wants that kind of worshipers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is Spirit. Those who worship Him must worship Him in spirit and in truth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to Him, “I know the Jews are looking for One Who is coming. He is called the Christ. When He comes, He will tell us everything.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “I am the Christ, the One talking with you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Right then the followers came back and were surprised and wondered about finding Him talking with a woman. But no one said, “What do You want?” or, “Why are You talking with her?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman left her water jar and went into the town. She said to the men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come and see a Man Who told me everything I ever did! Can this be the Christ?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out of town and came to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During this time His followers were saying to Him, “Teacher, eat something.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I have food to eat that you do not know of.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The followers said to each other, “Has someone taken food to Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “My food is to do what God wants Me to do and to finish His work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not say, ‘It is four months yet until the time to gather grain’? Listen! I say to you, open your eyes and look at the fields. They are white now and waiting for the grain to be gathered in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who gathers gets his pay. He gathers fruit that lasts forever. The one who plants and the one who gathers will have joy together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These words are true, ‘One man plants and another man gathers.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I sent you to gather where you have not planted. Others have planted and you have come along to gather in their fruit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people in that town of Samaria believed in Jesus because of what the woman said about Him. She said, “He told me everything I ever did.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people of Samaria came to Him. They asked Him to stay with them. Jesus stayed there two days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many more people believed because of what He said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to the woman, “Now we believe! It is no longer because of what you said about Jesus but we have heard Him ourselves. We know, for sure, that He is the Christ, the One Who saves men of this world from the punishment of their sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two days later He went from there and came to the country of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus Himself said that no one who speaks for God is respected in his own country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He came to Galilee, the people there were glad. They had seen all the things He did in Jerusalem. It was at the time of the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. They had been there also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came again to the town of Cana of Galilee where He had made water into wine. A man who worked with the king had a son who was sick in the city of Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man went to Jesus. He had heard that Jesus had come from the country of Judea to Galilee. The man asked Jesus if He would go to Capernaum and heal his son who was dying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Unless you see special things and powerful works done, you will not believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man said to Him, “Sir, come with me before my son dies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Go your way. Your son will live.” The man put his trust in what Jesus said and left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was on his way home, his servants met him. They said to him, “Your son is living!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them what time his boy began to get well. They said to him, “Yesterday at one o’clock the sickness left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The father knew it was the time Jesus had said to him, “Your son will live.” He and everyone in his house put their trust in Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the second powerful work that Jesus did after He came from the country of Judea to the country of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some time later, there was a religious gathering of the Jews. Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Jerusalem there is a pool with five porches called Bethesda near the sheep gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Inside these porches lay many sick people. Some were blind. Some could not walk. Some could not move their bodies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (An angel of the Lord came at certain times and made the water move. All of them were waiting for it to move. Whoever got in the water first after it was moving was healed of whatever sickness he had.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man was there who had been sick for thirty-eight years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw him lying there and knew the man had been sick a long time. Jesus said to him, “Would you like to be healed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sick man said, “Sir, I have no one to put me in the pool when the water is moving. While I am coming, another one gets in first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Get up! Pick up your bed and walk.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once the man was healed and picked up his bed and walked. This happened on the Day of Rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews said to the man who had been healed, “This is the Day of Rest. It is against the Law for you to carry your bed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “The Man Who healed me said to me, ‘Pick up your bed and walk.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews asked him, “What man said to you, ‘Pick up your bed and walk’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who had been healed did not know Who He was. Jesus had gone away while many people were there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later Jesus found the man who had been healed in the house of God. He said to him, “Listen! You have been healed. Stop sinning or something worse will come to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man went away and told the Jews that it was Jesus Who had healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because Jesus did these things on the Day of Rest, the Jews made it very hard for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “My Father is still working all the time so I am working also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews tried all the more to kill Him, not only because He had worked on the Day of Rest, but because He had also called God His Own Father. This made Him the same as God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “For sure, I tell you, the Son can do nothing by Himself. He does what He sees the Father doing. Whatever the Father does, the Son does also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father loves the Son and shows the Son everything He does. The Father will show Him greater works than these. They will surprise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father raises up the dead and makes them live. The Son also gives life to anyone He chooses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father does not say who is guilty. He gives this to the Son to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He does this so that all people will honor the Son as they honor the Father. He who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father Who sent Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For sure, I tell you, anyone who hears My Word and puts his trust in Him Who sent Me has life that lasts forever. He will not be guilty. He has already passed from death into life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For sure, I tell you, the time is coming. Yes, the time is here when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God. Those who hear will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father has life in Himself. He has given power to the Son to have life in Himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God has given Him the right and the power to say if people are guilty, because He is the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be surprised at this. The time is coming when all who are in their graves will hear His voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will come out. Those who have done good will be raised again and will have new life. Those who have been sinful will be raised again and will be told they are guilty and will be punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can do nothing by Myself. I say who is guilty only as My Father tells Me. That way, what I say is right, because I am not trying to do what I want to do. I am doing what the Father, Who sent Me, wants Me to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I tell about Myself, My words are worth nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is another One Who tells about Me. I know the words He says about Me are true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You sent to John the Baptist and he told you the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not need words from men to say I am right. I say this that you might be saved from the punishment of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John the Baptist was a burning and shining light. You were willing for awhile to be glad in his light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have something greater than John which tells of Me. I am doing works the Father has given Me to do and they are proving that the Father has sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father has told of Me and has sent Me. You have never heard His voice. You have never seen Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You do not have His Word living in your hearts because you do not put your trust in the One He sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You do read the Holy Writings. You think you have life that lasts forever just because you read them. They do tell of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you do not want to come to Me so you might have life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not take any honor from men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know you and you do not have the love of God in your hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have come in the name of My Father. You do not receive Me. If another person comes in his own name, you will receive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can you believe when you are always wanting honor from each other? And yet you do not look for the honor that comes from the only God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not think that I will tell the Father you are guilty. The one who says you are guilty is Moses. You trust him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you had believed Moses, you would believe Me. For Moses wrote about Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do not believe what he wrote, how will you believe My Words?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Jesus went over to the other side of the Sea of Galilee. It is sometimes called Tiberias.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people followed Him. They saw the powerful works He did on those who were sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went up on a mountain and sat down with His followers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The special religious supper to remember how the Jews left Egypt was soon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked up and saw many people coming to Him. He said to Philip, “Where can we buy bread to feed these people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this to see what Philip would say. Jesus knew what He would do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip said to Him, “The money we have is not enough to buy bread to give each one a little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of His followers was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother. He said to Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There is a boy here who has five loaves of barley bread and two small fish. What is that for so many people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Have the people sit down.” There was much grass in that place. About five thousand men sat down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus took the loaves and gave thanks. Then He gave the bread to those who were sitting down. The fish were given out the same way. The people had as much as they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were filled, Jesus said to His followers, “Gather up the pieces that are left. None will be wasted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The followers gathered the pieces together. Twelve baskets were filled with pieces of barley bread. These were left after all the people had eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people saw the powerful work Jesus had done. They said, “It is true! This is the One Who speaks for God Who is to come into the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew they were about to come and take Him to make Him king, so He went to the mountain by Himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening had come, His followers went down to the lake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They got into a boat and started to cross the lake to go to the city of Capernaum. By this time it was dark. Jesus had not come back to them yet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A strong wind was making high waves on the lake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were about half way across the lake when they saw Jesus walking on the water. As He got near the boat, they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus called to them, “It is I. Do not be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were glad to take Him into the boat. At once they got to the other side where they wanted to go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day the people on the other side of the lake saw no other boat there but the one His followers had been in. The people knew Jesus had not gone with His followers in the boat because they had gone alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were other boats from Tiberias that had come near the place where they had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people saw that Jesus and His followers were not there. They got into boats and went to Capernaum looking for Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people found Him on the other side of the lake. They said to Him, “Teacher, when did You come here?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “For sure, I tell you, you are not looking for Me because of the powerful works. You are looking for Me because you ate bread and were filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not work for food that does not last. Work for food that lasts forever. The Son of Man will give you that kind of food. God the Father has shown He will do this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people said to Him, “What are the works God wants us to do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “This is the work of God, that you put your trust in the One He has sent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Can You show us some powerful work? Then we can see it and believe You. What will You do?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our early fathers ate bread that came from heaven in the desert. This happened as it is written, ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the people, “For sure, I tell you, it was not Moses who gave you bread from heaven. My Father gives you the true Bread from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Bread of God is He Who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Sir, give us this Bread all the time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I am the Bread of Life. He who comes to Me will never be hungry. He who puts his trust in Me will never be thirsty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I said to you that you have seen Me and yet you do not put your trust in Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All whom My Father has given to Me will come to Me. I will never turn away anyone who comes to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I came down from heaven. I did not come to do what I wanted to do. I came to do what My Father wanted Me to do. He is the One Who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Father sent Me. He did not want Me to lose any of all those He gave Me. He wants Me to raise them to life on the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He wants everyone who sees the Son to put his trust in Him and have life that lasts forever. I will raise that one up on the last day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews talked among themselves against Him. They did not like it because He said, “I am the Bread that came down from heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked each other, “Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph? We know His father and mother. How can He say, ‘I came down from heaven’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Do not talk among yourselves against Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father sent Me. No man can come to Me unless the Father gives him the desire to come to Me. Then I will raise him to life on the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The early preachers wrote, ‘They will all be taught of God.’ Everyone who listens to the Father and learns from Him comes to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one has seen the Father. I am the only One Who has seen Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, he who puts his trust in Me has life that lasts forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Bread of Life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your early fathers ate bread that came from heaven in the desert. They died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this is the Bread that comes down from heaven. The one who eats it never dies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Living Bread that came down from heaven. If anyone eats this Bread, he will live forever. The Bread which I will give is My flesh. I will give this for the life of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews argued among themselves, saying, “How can this Man give us His flesh to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “For sure, I tell you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink His blood, you do not have life in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever eats My flesh and drinks My blood has life that lasts forever. I will raise him up on the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My flesh is true food and My blood is true drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever eats My flesh and drinks My blood lives in Me and I live in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The living Father sent Me and I live because of Him. In the same way, the one who eats Me will live because of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am this Bread that came down from heaven. It is not like the bread that your early fathers ate and they died. Whoever eats this Bread will live forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said these things in the Jewish place of worship while He was teaching in the city of Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After hearing this, many of His followers said, “This teaching is too hard! Who can listen to it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew His followers talked against what He had said. He said to them, “Does this trouble you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then what would you say if you saw the Son of Man going up where He was before?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is the Spirit that gives life. The flesh is of no help. The words I speak to you are spirit and life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of you do not believe.” Jesus knew from the beginning who would not put their trust in Him. He knew who would hand Him over to the leaders of the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “That is why I told you no one can come to Me unless the Father allows it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that time on, many of His followers turned back to their old ways of living. They would not go along with Him after that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the twelve followers, “Will you leave Me also?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, who else can we go to? You have words that give life that lasts forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We believe and know You are the Christ. You are the Son of the Living God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I chose you twelve as My followers. And one of you is a devil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was speaking of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, who was one of the twelve followers. He was ready to hand Jesus over to the leaders of the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus did not stay in the country of Judea because the Jews were trying to kill Him. After this He went from place to place in the country of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A religious gathering of the Jews was near. This gathering was called the Supper of Tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The brothers of Jesus said to Him, “Leave here and go to the country of Judea. Let Your followers there see the things You do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a person wants others to know what he is doing, he does things to be seen. Since You are doing such things, show Yourself to the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not even His brothers were putting their trust in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “My time has not yet come. But any time is good for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The world cannot hate you but it hates Me. I speak against the world because of its sinful works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You go to the religious gathering. I am not going yet. My time has not yet come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told His brothers this and then stayed in Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His brothers went to the religious gathering. He went later by Himself so He would not be seen there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the religious gathering the Jews were looking for Jesus. They were saying, “Where is He?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was much talk among the people about Him. Some said, “He is a good Man.” Others said, “No, He leads the people in the wrong way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one spoke about Him in front of other people. They were afraid of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious gathering was half over when Jesus went to the house of God and taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews were surprised and wondered, saying, “How can this Man know so much when He has never been to school?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “What I teach is not Mine. It is from God Who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone will do what God wants, he will know if My teaching is from God, or if I am speaking of Myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who speaks of himself is looking for greatness for himself. But He Who is looking for the greatness of the One Who sent Him is true. There is nothing false in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did not Moses give you the Law? And yet not one of you keeps the Law. Why do you try to kill me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people said, “You have a demon in You. Who is trying to kill You?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I did one work and you are surprised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave you the religious act of becoming a Jew. (Yet it was not from Moses but from the early fathers.) You do this religious act on a man on the Day of Rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if you can do that, why are you angry with Me for healing a man on the Day of Rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not say a person is guilty by what you see. Be sure you know when you say what is right or wrong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the people of Jerusalem said, “Is not this the Man the Jews want to kill?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But see! This Man is speaking out in the open. They are saying nothing to Him. Do the leaders know this is the true Christ?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know where this Man came from. When the Christ comes, no one will know where He comes from.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus spoke with a loud voice as He taught in the house of God. He said, “You know Me. You know where I came from. I have not come on My own. The One Who sent Me is true but you do not know Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know Him because I am from Him and He sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they wanted to take Jesus but no one put his hands on Him. His time had not yet come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of the people believed in Him. They said, “When Christ comes, will He do more powerful works than this Man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers heard the people talking about Jesus. The religious leaders of the Jews and the proud religious law-keepers sent soldiers to take Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I will be with you a little while yet. Then I will go back to Him Who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will look for Me but you will not find Me. Where I go, you cannot come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews said to themselves, “Where can He go that we will not find Him? Will He go to our people who live among the Greeks and teach the Greeks?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What does He mean when He says, ‘You will look for Me but you will not find Me, and where I go, you cannot come’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the last and great day of the religious gathering. Jesus stood up and spoke with a loud voice, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to Me and drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Holy Writings say that rivers of living water will flow from the heart of the one who puts his trust in Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said this about the Holy Spirit Who would come to those who put their trust in Him. The Holy Spirit had not yet been given. Jesus had not yet been raised to the place of honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When many of the people heard His words, they said, “For sure, this is the One Who speaks for God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said, “He is the Christ!” Some said, “The Christ would not come from the country of Galilee, would He?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not the Holy Writings say that the Christ will come from the family of David? Will He not come from the town of Bethlehem where David lived?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were divided in what they thought about Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them wanted to take Him. But no one put their hands on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers came back to the religious leaders of the Jews and to the proud religious law-keepers. They said to the soldiers, “Why did you not bring Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers answered, “No man has ever spoken like this Man speaks.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers said, “Have you been led the wrong way also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has anyone of the leaders or anyone from our group believed in Him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for all these people, they do not know the Law. They are guilty and will be punished by God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Nicodemus was one of the proud religious law-keepers. He had come to Jesus at another time.) Nicodemus said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Our Law does not say a man is guilty before he has been in court and before we know what he has done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Are you from Galilee also? Look into the Word of God yourself. You will see that no one who speaks for God comes from Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then everyone went home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the morning He went back to the house of God and all the people came to Him. He sat down and taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The teachers of the Law and the proud religious law-keepers came to Him. They brought a woman who had been caught doing a sex sin. They made her stand in front of them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to Jesus, “Teacher, this woman was caught in the act of doing a sex sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses told us in the Law to throw stones and kill a woman like this. What do You say about it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were trying to set a trap to find something against Him. Jesus got down and began to write in the dust with His finger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept on asking Him. Then He stood up and said, “Anyone of you who is without sin can throw the first stone at her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again He got down and wrote in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard what He said, they went away one by one, beginning with the older ones until they were all gone. Then Jesus was left alone with the woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus stood up and said to her, “Woman, where are those who spoke against you? Has no man said you are guilty?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said, “No one, Sir.” Jesus said to her, “Neither do I say you are guilty. Go on your way and do not sin again.”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus spoke to all the people, saying, “I am the Light of the world. Anyone who follows Me will not walk in darkness. He will have the Light of Life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers said to Him, “You are talking about Yourself. What You say about Yourself is not true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Even if I speak of Myself, what I am saying is true. I know where I came from and where I am going. You do not know where I came from or where I am going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You say as a man would say if people are guilty or not guilty. I am not saying anyone is guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even if I did, it would be true. I am not alone. The Father Who sent Me is with Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is written in your Law that when two men agree about something, it proves it is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I speak for Myself and the Father Who sent Me speaks for Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers asked Him, “Where is Your Father?” Jesus said, “You do not know Me or My Father. If you had known Me, you would have known My Father also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus spoke these words near the money box while He taught in the house of God. No one put his hands on Jesus because His time had not yet come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus spoke to the Jews again, saying, “I am going away. You will look for Me but you will die in your sins. Where I am going, you cannot come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews said, “Will He kill Himself because He said, ‘Where I am going you cannot come’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered them, “You are from below. I am from above. You are of this world. I am not of this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why I said that you will die in your sins. If you do not believe that I am the Christ, you will die in your sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to Him, “Who are You?” Jesus answered, “The answer is the same as I told you from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have much to say about you. I must say if you are guilty. But He Who sent Me is true. I tell the world the things I have heard from Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not understand that Jesus was speaking to them about the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “When you have lifted up the Son of Man, you will know that I am the Christ. I do nothing of Myself. I say these things as My Father has taught Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that sent Me is with Me. The Father has not left Me alone. I always do what He wants Me to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus said these things, many people put their trust in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the Jews who believed, “If you keep and obey My Word, then you are My followers for sure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will know the truth and the truth will make you free.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Jesus, “We are children of Abraham. We have never been servants to anyone. What do you mean when You say, ‘You will be free’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “For sure, I tell you, everyone who sins is the servant of sin because sin has a hold on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the servant does not belong in the house. The son belongs in the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if the Son makes you free, you will be free for sure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I know that you are the children of Abraham. But you want to kill Me because My Word is not in your hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I speak of what I saw when I was with My Father. You do what you have seen your father do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Him, “Abraham is our father.” Jesus said, “If you were children of Abraham, you would do what he did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am a Man Who has told you the truth as I heard it from God. Now you are trying to kill Me. Abraham never did anything like that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are doing the works of your father.” They said to Him, “We were born of parents who were faithful in marriage. We have one Father. He is God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “If God were your father, you would love Me. I came from God. I did not come on My own, but God sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you not understand what I say? It is because you do not want to hear My teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The devil is your father. You are from him. You want to do the sinful things your father, the devil, wants you to do. He has been a killer from the beginning. The devil has nothing to do with the truth. There is no truth in him. It is expected of the devil to lie, for he is a liar and the father of lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth and that is why you do not put your trust in Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which one of you can say I am guilty of sin? If I tell you the truth, why do you not believe Me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever is born of God listens to God’s Word. You do not hear His Word because you are not born of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews said to Jesus, “Are we not right when we say You are from the country of Samaria, and You have a demon?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “No, I do not have a demon. I honor My Father. You do not honor Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not looking for honor for Myself. There is One Who is looking for it. He says what is right from wrong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, if anyone keeps My Word, that one will never die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews said to Him, “Now we know You have a demon. Abraham died. The early preachers died. You say, ‘If anyone keeps My Word, that one will never die.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are you greater than our father Abraham? He died and the early preachers died. Who do You think You are?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “If I honor Myself, My honor would be worth nothing. My Father honors Me. You say He is your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have never known Him, but I know Him. If I said I did not know Him, I would be a liar like you. But I do know the Father and obey His Word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your father Abraham was glad that he was to see My coming. He saw it and was happy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews said to Jesus, “You are not even fifty years old. How could you have seen Abraham?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “For sure, I tell you, before Abraham was born, I was and am and always will be!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they picked up stones to throw at Him. Jesus hid Himself and left the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus went on His way, He saw a man who had been born blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His followers asked Him, “Teacher, whose sin made this man to be born blind? Was it the sin of this man or the sin of his parents?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “The sin of this man or the sin of his parents did not make him to be born blind. He was born blind so the work of God would be seen in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We must keep on doing the work of Him Who sent Me while it is day. Night is coming when no man can work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While I am in the world, I am the Light of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had said this, He spit on the ground. He mixed it with dust and put that mud on the eyes of the blind man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Go and wash in the pool of Siloam.” (Siloam means Sent.) The man went away and washed. When he came back, he could see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neighbors and others had seen him begging. They said, “Is not this the man who sat and begged?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some said, “This is the one.” Others said, “No, but he looks like him.” But the man who had been blind said, “I am the man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “How were your eyes opened?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “A Man called Jesus made mud and put it on my eyes. Then He said to me, ‘Go and wash in the pool of Siloam.’ I went and washed and I can see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they asked him, “Where is He?” He answered, “I do not know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took the man who had been born blind to the proud religious law-keepers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the Day of Rest when Jesus had made mud and opened his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the proud religious law-keepers asked the man who had been born blind how he had been made to see. He answered them, “Jesus put mud on my eyes. I washed and now I see!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the proud religious law-keepers said, “The Man Who did this is not from God because He worked on the Day of Rest.” Others said, “How can a sinful man do powerful works?” They could not agree about Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They spoke again to the blind man, saying, “What do you say about Him since He opened your eyes?” He answered, “He is One Who speaks for God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews did not believe this man had been blind and had been made to see. They called his parents
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and asked them, “Is this your son? Do you say he was born blind? How does he see now?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered, “We know this is our son and we know he was born blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we do not know how it is that he can see now. We do not know who opened his eyes. He is old enough, ask him. He can tell you himself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His parents said this because they were afraid of the Jews. The Jews had talked among themselves. They had agreed that the person who said that Jesus was the Christ would be put out of the Jewish place of worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why his parents said, “He is old enough, ask him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers asked the man again, who had been blind, to come. They said to him, “Give thanks to God. We know this man is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who had been blind said to them, “I do not know if He is a sinner or not. One thing I know. I was blind, but now I can see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him again, “What did He do to you? How did He open your eyes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “I have told you already. You did not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you want to become His followers also?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers became angry at him and said, “You are a follower of Jesus. We are followers of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know God spoke to Moses. We do not know where this Man is from.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man said to them, “This is strange! You do not know where He came from and yet He opened my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that God does not listen to sinners. We know if anyone loves and worships God, and does what He wants, God listens to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the beginning of the world no one has ever heard of anyone opening the eyes of a man born blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If this Man were not from God, He would not be able to do anything like this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “You were born in sin. Are you trying to teach us?” Then they put him out of the place of worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus heard that the proud religious law-keepers had put the man who had been healed out of the place of worship. He found the man and said to him, “Do you put your trust in the Son of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Who is He, Sir? Tell me so that I can put my trust in Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “You have seen Him. He is talking with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I do put my trust in You, Lord.” Then he bowed down before Jesus and worshiped Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “I came into this world to say what is right from wrong. I came so those who do not see might see, and those who do see might be made blind.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the proud religious law-keepers who were with Him heard this. They said to Him, “Are we blind also?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “If you were blind, you would not be guilty of sin. But because you say, ‘We see,’ you still are guilty of your sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For sure, I tell you, the man who goes into the sheep-pen some other way than through the door is one who steals and robs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The shepherd of the sheep goes in through the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who watches the door opens it for him. The sheep listen to the voice of the shepherd. He calls his own sheep by name and he leads them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the shepherd walks ahead of them, they follow him because they know his voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will not follow someone they do not know because they do not know his voice. They will run away from him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told this picture-story to them. Yet they did not understand what He said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again Jesus said to them, “For sure, I tell you, I am the Door of the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All others who came ahead of Me are men who steal and rob. The sheep did not obey them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Door. Anyone who goes in through Me will be saved from the punishment of sin. He will go in and out and find food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The robber comes only to steal and to kill and to destroy. I came so they might have life, a great full life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the Good Shepherd. The Good Shepherd gives His life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One who is hired to watch the sheep is not the shepherd. He does not own the sheep. He sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep. He runs away while the wolf gets the sheep and makes them run everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hired man runs away because he is hired. He does not care about the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the Good Shepherd. I know My sheep and My sheep know Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know My Father as My Father knows Me. I give My life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have other sheep which are not from this sheep-pen. I must bring them also. They will listen to My voice. Then there will be one flock with one shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For this reason My Father loves Me. It is because I give My life that I might take it back again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one takes my life from Me. I give it by Myself. I have the right and the power to take it back again. My Father has given Me this right and power.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of what He said, the Jews did not agree in their thinking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of them said, “He has a demon and is crazy. Why listen to Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said, “A man who has a demon does not talk this way. Can a demon open the eyes of a blind man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was time for the religious gathering of remembering how the house of God was opened in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was winter and Jesus was there. He was walking in Solomon’s porch in the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews gathered around Him. They said, “How long are You going to keep us in doubt? If You are the Christ, tell us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “I told you and you do not believe. The works I do in My Father’s name speak of Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You do not believe because you are not My sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My sheep hear My voice and I know them. They follow Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I give them life that lasts forever. They will never be punished. No one is able to take them out of My hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My Father Who gave them to Me is greater than all. No one is able to take them out of My Father’s hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My Father and I are one!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the Jews picked up stones to throw at Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Many good things have I shown you from My Father. For which of these things are you going to throw stones at Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “We are not going to throw stones at You for any good work. It is because of the way You talk against God. It is because You make Yourself to be God when You are only a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Is it not written in your Law, ‘I said, you are gods’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Holy Writings were given to them and God called them gods. (The Word of God cannot be put aside.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God has set Me apart for Himself. He sent Me into the world. Then how can you say that I am speaking against God because I said, ‘I am the Son of God’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I am not doing the works of My Father, do not believe Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I do them, even if you do not believe Me, believe the works that I do. Then you will know the Father is in Me and I am in Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tried again to take Him but He got out of their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went away to the other side of the Jordan River to the place where John was baptizing people. Jesus stayed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people came to Him and said, “John did no powerful work, but what John said about this Man is true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people put their trust in Jesus there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man named Lazarus was sick. He lived in the town of Bethany with his sisters, Mary and Martha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the Mary who put perfume on the Lord and dried His feet with her hair. It was her brother Lazarus who was sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sisters sent word to Jesus, saying, “Lord, your friend is sick!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard this, He said, “This sickness will not end in death. It has happened so that it will bring honor to God. And the Son of God will be honored by it also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when He heard that Lazarus was sick, He stayed where He was two more days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to His followers, “Let us go into the country of Judea again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The followers said to Him, “Teacher, the Jews tried to throw stones at You to kill You not long ago. Are You going there again?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Are there not twelve hours in the day? If a man walks during the day, he will not fall. He sees the light of this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a man walks during the night, he will fall. The light is not in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had said this, He spoke again and said, “Our friend Lazarus is sleeping. I will go and wake him up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The followers said to Him, “If he is sleeping, he will get well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus meant Lazarus was dead. They thought He meant Lazarus was resting in sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Lazarus is dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of you I am glad I was not there so that you may believe. Come, let us go to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas, who was called the Twin, said to the other followers, “Let us go also so we may die with Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus got there, He heard that Lazarus had been in the grave four days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bethany was about one-half hour walk from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many Jews had come to Martha and Mary to give words of comfort about their brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Martha heard that Jesus was coming and went to meet Him. Mary stayed in the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know even now God will give You whatever You ask.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Your brother will rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Martha said to Him, “I know that he will rise again when the dead are raised from the grave on the last day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “I am the One Who raises the dead and gives them life. Anyone who puts his trust in Me will live again, even if he dies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who lives and has put his trust in Me will never die. Do you believe this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She answered, “Yes, Lord, I believe that You are the Christ, the Son of God. You are the One Who was to come into the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Martha said this, she went and called her sister Mary. She said without anyone else hearing, “The Teacher is here and has sent for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Mary heard this, she got up and went to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus had not yet come into their town. He was still where Martha had met Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews had been in the house comforting Mary. They saw her get up and hurry out. They followed her and said, “She is going to the grave to cry there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary went to the place where Jesus was. When she saw Him, she got down at His feet. She said to Him, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw her crying. The Jews who came with her were crying also. His heart was very sad and He was troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Where did you lay Lazarus?” They said, “Lord, come and see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus cried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews said, “See how much He loved Lazarus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them said, “This Man opened the eyes of the blind man. Could He not have kept this man from dying?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went to the grave with a sad heart. The grave was a hole in the side of a hill. A stone covered the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Take the stone away.” The dead man’s sister, Martha, said to Him, “Lord, by now his body has a bad smell. He has been dead four days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Did I not say that if you would believe, you would see the shining-greatness of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took the stone away. Jesus looked up and said, “Father, I thank You for hearing Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know You always hear Me. But I have said this for the people standing here, so they may believe You have sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had said this, He called with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man who had been dead came out. His hands and feet were tied in grave clothes. A white cloth was tied around his face. Jesus said to the people, “Take off the grave clothes and let him go!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of the Jews who had come to visit Mary and had seen what Jesus had done put their trust in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them went to the proud religious law-keepers and told them what Jesus had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders of the Jews and the proud religious law-keepers gathered a court together. They said, “What will we do? This Man is doing many powerful works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we let Him keep doing these things, all men will put their trust in Him. The Romans will come and take away the house of God and our nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caiaphas was the head religious leader that year. He said to them, “You know nothing about this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not see it is better for one man to die for the people than for the whole nation to be destroyed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caiaphas did not think of these words himself. He spoke what God had said would happen. He was telling before it happened that Jesus must die for the nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must die not only for the nation, but also to bring together into one group the children of God who were living in many places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that day on they talked together about how they might kill Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason Jesus did not walk out in the open among the Jews. He went to a town called Ephraim. It was near a desert. He stayed there with His followers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt was soon. Many people from around the country came up to Jerusalem to go through the religious washing before the special supper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They looked for Jesus. They stood together in the house of God and asked each other, “What do you think? Will He come to the special supper?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders of the Jews and the proud religious law-keepers had said that if any man knew where Jesus was, he should tell them. They wanted to take Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was six days before the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. Jesus came to Bethany where Lazarus lived. Jesus had raised Lazarus from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made supper for Him. Martha put the food on the table. Lazarus was at the table with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary took a jar of special perfume that cost much money and poured it on the feet of Jesus. She dried His feet with her hair. The house was filled with the smell of the special perfume.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas Iscariot was one of the followers. He was about to hand Jesus over to the leaders of the country. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why was not this special perfume sold for much money and given to poor people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not say this because he cared for poor people. He said this because he was a robber. He carried the bag of money and would steal some of it for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Let her alone. She has kept it for the time when I will be buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will always have poor people with you. You will not always have Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many Jews came to the place because they knew Jesus was there. They came not only to see Jesus, but to see Lazarus also. Jesus had raised Lazarus from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator
