verses.text: The religious leaders of the Jews talked together about having Lazarus killed also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of Lazarus, many Jews were leaving their own religion. They were putting their trust in Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day many people were in Jerusalem for the religious gathering. They heard Jesus was coming.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took branches of trees and went to meet Him. They spoke with a loud voice, “Greatest One! Great and honored is He Who comes in the name of the Lord, the King of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus found a young donkey and sat on it. The Holy Writings say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not be afraid, people of Jerusalem. See! Your King comes sitting on a young donkey!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His followers did not understand what this meant at first. When Jesus had gone back to heaven to receive great honor, they remembered these things were written about Him. They remembered they had done this to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people who had been with Jesus when He had called Lazarus from the grave kept telling of this powerful work to others. They had seen Lazarus raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this the people went to meet Jesus. They had heard He had done this powerful work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The proud religious law-keepers said among themselves, “Look, we are losing followers. Everyone is following Jesus!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Greek people had come to worship at the religious gathering. They were among the others who had come to worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These Greek people came to Philip. He was from the city of Bethsaida in the country of Galilee. They said to him, “Sir, we want to see Jesus!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip went and told Andrew. Then Andrew and Philip told Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “The hour is near for the Son of Man to be taken to heaven to receive great honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, unless a seed falls into the ground and dies, it will only be a seed. If it dies, it will give much grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who loves his life will lose it. Anyone who hates his life in this world will keep it forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone wants to serve Me, he must follow Me. So where I am, the one who wants to serve Me will be there also. If anyone serves Me, My Father will honor him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now My soul is troubled. Should I say, ‘Father, save Me from this time of trouble and pain’? No, this is why I came to this time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Father, honor Your name!”
Then a voice from heaven came, saying, “I have already honored My name. I will honor it again!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people heard the voice. Some who stood there said, “It was thunder.” Others said, “An angel spoke to Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “The voice did not come for Me, but it came to be a help to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now this world is being told it is guilty. Now the leader of this world will be thrown out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when I am lifted up from the earth, I will attract all people toward Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this to tell the kind of death He was going to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people said to Him, “The Law of Moses says that the Christ is to live forever. Why do you say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this Son of Man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “The Light will be with you for a little while yet. Go on your way while you have the Light so you will not be in the dark. When a man is walking in the dark, he does not know where he is going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While you have the Light, put your trust in the Light. Then you will be the sons of the Light.” Jesus said these things and then went away. He hid Himself from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus had done many powerful works in front of them, but they did not put their trust in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened as the words of the early preacher Isaiah said it would happen. He had said, “Lord, has anyone believed our preaching? Has the Lord shown His power to anyone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The reason they could not believe is written again in Isaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It says, “He has blinded their eyes and made their hearts hard. Then they would not see with their eyes. They would not understand with their heart. They would not turn to Me. I could not heal them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Isaiah said when he saw the shining-greatness of Jesus and spoke of Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even among the leaders of the people there were many who believed in Jesus. But because of the proud religious law-keepers, they did not tell about it. If they had, they would have been put out of the Jewish place of worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They loved to have the respect from men more than honor from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus spoke with a loud voice, “Anyone who puts his trust in Me, puts his trust not only in Me, but in Him Who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who sees Me, sees Him Who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I came to the world to be a Light. Anyone who puts his trust in Me will not be in darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone hears My Words but does not believe them, I do not say he is guilty. I did not come to say the world is guilty. I came to save the world from the punishment of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who does not receive Me and does not receive My teaching has One Who will say he is guilty. The Word that I have spoken will say he is guilty on the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not spoken by My own power. The Father Who sent Me has told Me what to say and speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know that His Word is life that lasts forever. I speak the things the Father has told Me to speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was before the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. Jesus knew the time had come for Him to leave this world and go to the Father. He had loved His own who were in the world. He loved them to the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He and His followers were having supper. Satan had put the thought into the heart of Judas Iscariot of handing Jesus over to the leaders of the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew the Father had put everything into His hands. He knew He had come from God and was going back to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus got up from the supper and took off His coat. He picked up a cloth and put it around Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He put water into a wash pan and began to wash the feet of His followers. He dried their feet with the cloth He had put around Himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came to Simon Peter. Peter said to Him, “Lord, are You going to wash my feet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered him, “You do not understand now what I am doing but you will later.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Him, “I will never let You wash my feet.” Jesus said, “Unless I wash you, you will not be a part of Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, do not wash only my feet, but wash my hands and my head also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Anyone who has washed his body needs only to wash his feet. Then he is clean all over. You are all clean except one.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew who was going to hand Him over to the leaders. That is why He said, “You are all clean except one.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus washed their feet and put on His coat. Then He sat down again and said to them, “Do you understand what I have done to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You call Me Teacher and Lord. You are right because that is what I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am your Teacher and Lord. I have washed your feet. You should wash each other’s feet also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have done this to show you what should be done. You should do as I have done to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, a workman who is owned by someone is not greater than his owner. One who is sent is not greater than the one who sent him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you know these things, you will be happy if you do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am not speaking about all of you. I know the ones I have chosen. What is written in the Holy Writings must happen. It says, ‘The man who eats bread with Me has turned against Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you this now before it happens. After it happens, you will believe that I am Who I say I am, the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, he who receives the one I send out, receives Me. He who receives Me receives Him who sent Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had said this, He was troubled in heart. He told them in very plain words, saying, “For sure, I tell you, one of you is going to hand Me over to the leaders of the country.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The followers began to look at each other. They did not know which one He was speaking of.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One follower, whom Jesus loved, was beside Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter got this follower to look his way. He wanted him to ask Jesus which one He was speaking of.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While close beside Jesus, he asked, “Lord, who is it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “It is the one I give this piece of bread to after I have put it in the dish.” Then He put the bread in the dish and gave it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Judas had eaten the piece of bread, Satan went into him. Jesus said to Judas, “What you are going to do, do in a hurry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one at the supper knew why Jesus had said this to Judas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They thought it was because Judas carried the bag of money, and Jesus had said that Judas should buy what they needed for the religious gathering. Or they thought Judas should give something to poor people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Judas had taken the piece of bread, he went out. It was night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Judas went out, Jesus said, “The Son of Man is now honored and God has been honored in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If God is honored in Him, God will also honor Him in Himself right now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Little children, I will be with you only a little while. You will look for Me. I say to you what I said to the Jews, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I give you a new Law. You are to love each other. You must love each other as I have loved you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you love each other, all men will know you are My followers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, where are You going?” Jesus answered, “You cannot follow Me now where I am going. Later you will follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Jesus, “Why can I not follow You now? I will die for You.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered Peter, “Will you die for Me? For sure, I tell you, before a rooster crows, you will have said three times that you do not know Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not let your heart be troubled. You have put your trust in God, put your trust in Me also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are many rooms in My Father’s house. If it were not so, I would have told you. I am going away to make a place for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After I go and make a place for you, I will come back and take you with Me. Then you may be where I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know where I am going and you know how to get there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas said to Jesus, “Lord, we do not know where You are going. How can we know the way to get there?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “I am the Way and the Truth and the Life. No one can go to the Father except by Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you had known Me, you would know My Father also. From now on you know Him and have seen Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip said to Jesus, “Lord, show us the Father. That is all we ask.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Have I been with you all this time and you do not know Me yet? Whoever has seen Me, has seen the Father. How can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not believe that I am in the Father and that the Father is in Me? What I say to you, I do not say by My own power. The Father Who lives in Me does His work through Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Believe Me that I am in the Father and that the Father is in Me. Or else believe Me because of the things I do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, whoever puts his trust in Me can do the things I am doing. He will do even greater things than these because I am going to the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever you ask in My name, I will do it so the shining-greatness of the Father may be seen in the Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, if you ask anything in My name, I will do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you love Me, you will do what I say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will ask My Father and He will give you another Helper. He will be with you forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the Spirit of Truth. The world cannot receive Him. It does not see Him or know Him. You know Him because He lives with you and will be in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will not leave you without help as children without parents. I will come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a little while the world will see Me no more. You will see Me. Because I live, you will live also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When that day comes, you will know that I am in My Father. You will know that you are in Me. You will know that I am in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who loves Me is the one who has My teaching and obeys it. My Father will love whoever loves Me. I will love him and will show Myself to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other Judas (not Iscariot) said to Him, “Why is it You are going to show Yourself to us followers and not to the world?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “The one who loves Me will obey My teaching. My Father will love him. We will come to him and live with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who does not love Me does not obey My teaching. The teaching you are now hearing is not My teaching but it is from My Father Who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have told you these things while I am still with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Helper is the Holy Spirit. The Father will send Him in My place. He will teach you everything and help you remember everything I have told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Peace I leave with you. My peace I give to you. I do not give peace to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled or afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You heard Me say that I am going away. But I am coming back to you. If you love Me, you would be glad that I am going to the Father. The Father is greater than I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have told you this before it happens. Then when it does happen, you will believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will not talk much more with you. The leader of this world is coming. He has no power over Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am doing what the Father told Me to do so the world may know I love the Father. Come, let us be on our way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the true Vine. My Father is the One Who cares for the Vine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He takes away any branch in Me that does not give fruit. Any branch that gives fruit, He cuts it back so it will give more fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are made clean by the words I have spoken to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get your life from Me and I will live in you. No branch can give fruit by itself. It has to get life from the vine. You are able to give fruit only when you have life from Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Vine and you are the branches. Get your life from Me. Then I will live in you and you will give much fruit. You can do nothing without Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone does not get his life from Me, he is cut off like a branch and dries up. Such branches are gathered and thrown into the fire and they are burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you get your life from Me and My Words live in you, ask whatever you want. It will be done for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you give much fruit, My Father is honored. This shows you are My followers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have loved you just as My Father has loved Me. Stay in My love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you obey My teaching, you will live in My love. In this way, I have obeyed My Father’s teaching and live in His love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have told you these things so My joy may be in you and your joy may be full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what I tell you to do: Love each other just as I have loved you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one can have greater love than to give his life for his friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are My friends if you do what I tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not call you servants that I own anymore. A servant does not know what his owner is doing. I call you friends, because I have told you everything I have heard from My Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have not chosen Me, I have chosen you. I have set you apart for the work of bringing in fruit. Your fruit should last. And whatever you ask the Father in My name, He will give it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what I tell you to do: Love each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the world hates you, you know it hated Me before it hated you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you belonged to the world, the world would love you as its own. You do not belong to the world. I have chosen you out of the world and the world hates you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember I said to you, ‘A servant is not greater than his owner.’ If they made it very hard for Me, they will make it very hard for you also. If they obeyed My teachings, they will obey your teachings also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will do all these things to you because you belong to Me. They do not know My Father Who sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have come and have spoken to them so they are guilty of sin. But now they have no reason to give for keeping their sin any longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever hates Me, hates My Father also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have done things among them which no one else has done so they are guilty of sin. But now they have seen these things and have hated Me and My Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened as their Law said it would happen, ‘They hated Me without a reason.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Helper (Holy Spirit) will tell about Me when He comes. I will send Him to you from the Father. He is the Spirit of Truth and comes from the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will also tell of Me because you have been with Me from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have told you these things so you will not be ashamed of Me and leave Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will put you out of the places of worship. The time will come when anyone who kills you will think he is helping God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will do these things to you because they do not know the Father or Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When these things happen, you will remember I told you they would happen. That is why I am telling you about these things now. I did not tell you these things before, because I was with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now I am going to Him Who sent Me. Yet none of you asks Me, ‘Where are You going?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Your hearts are full of sorrow because I am telling you these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth. It is better for you that I go away. If I do not go, the Helper will not come to you. If I go, I will send Him to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Helper comes, He will show the world the truth about sin. He will show the world about being right with God. And He will show the world what it is to be guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will show the world about sin, because they do not put their trust in Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will show the world about being right with God, because I go to My Father and you will see Me no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will show the world what it is to be guilty because the leader of this world (Satan) is guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I still have many things to say to you. You are not strong enough to understand them now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Holy Spirit is coming. He will lead you into all truth. He will not speak His Own words. He will speak what He hears. He will tell you of things to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will honor Me. He will receive what is Mine and will tell it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything the Father has is Mine. That is why I said to you, ‘He will receive what is Mine and will tell it to you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In a little while you will not see Me. Then in a little while you will see Me again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of His followers said to each other, “What is He trying to tell us when He says, ‘In a little while you will not see Me, and in a little while you will see Me again,’ and ‘Because I go to My Father’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said, “What is He trying to tell us by saying, ‘A little while’? We do not know what He is talking about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew they wanted to ask Him something. He said to them, “Are you asking each other why I said, ‘In a little while you will not see Me, and in a little while you will see Me again’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, you will cry and have sorrow, but the world will have joy. You will have sorrow, but your sorrow will turn into joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a woman gives birth to a child, she has sorrow because her time has come. After the child is born, she forgets her pain. She is full of joy because a child has been born into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are sad now. I will see you again and then your hearts will be full of joy. No one can take your joy from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the time comes that you see Me again, you will ask Me no question. For sure, I tell you, My Father will give you whatever you ask in My name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until now you have not asked for anything in My name. Ask and you will receive. Then your joy will be full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have told you these things in picture-stories. The time is coming when I will not use picture-stories. I will talk about My Father in plain words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day you will ask in My name. I will not ask the Father for you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the Father loves you. He loves you because you love Me and believe that I came from the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I came from the Father and have come into the world. I am leaving the world and going to the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His followers said to Him, “Now You are talking in plain words. You are not using picture-stories.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we are sure You know everything. You do not need anyone to tell You anything. Because of this we believe that You came from God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Do you believe now?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The time is coming, yes, it is already here when you will be going your own way. Everyone will go to his own house and leave Me alone. Yet I am not alone because the Father is with Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have told you these things so you may have peace in Me. In the world you will have much trouble. But take hope! I have power over the world!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had said these things, He looked up to heaven and said, “Father, the time has come! Honor Your Son so Your Son may honor You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have given Him power over all men. He is to give life that lasts forever to all You have given to Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is life that lasts forever. It is to know You, the only true God, and to know Jesus Christ Whom You have sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I honored You on earth. I did the work You gave Me to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, Father, honor Me with the honor I had with You before the world was made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have made Your name known to the people You have given Me from the world. They were Yours but You gave them to Me. They have obeyed Your Word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they know that everything You have given Me came from You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave them the Word which You gave Me. They received it. They know I came from You and they believe You sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I pray for them. I do not pray for the world. I pray for those You gave Me. They are Yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that is Mine is Yours. All that is Yours is Mine. I have been honored through them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am no longer in the world. I am coming to You. But these are still in the world. Holy Father, keep those You have given to Me in the power of Your name. Then they will be one, even as We are One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While I have been with them in the world, I have kept them in the power of Your name. I have kept watch over those You gave Me. Not one of them has been lost except the one who is going to be destroyed, which is the son of death. The Holy Writings said it would happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now I come to You, Father. I say these things while I am in the world. In this way, My followers may have My joy in their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have given Your Word to My followers. The world hated them because they do not belong to the world, even as I do not belong to the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not ask You to take them out of the world. I ask You to keep them from the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My followers do not belong to the world just as I do not belong to the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make them holy for Yourself by the truth. Your Word is truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As You sent Me into the world so I have sent them into the world also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I set Myself apart to be holy for them. Then they may be made holy by the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I do not pray for these followers only. I pray for those who will put their trust in Me through the teaching they have heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May they all be as one, Father, as You are in Me and I am in You. May they belong to Us. Then the world will believe that You sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave them the honor You gave Me that they may be one as We are One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am in them and You are in Me so they may be one and be made perfect. Then the world may know that You sent Me and that You love them as You love Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Father, I want My followers You gave Me to be with Me where I am. Then they may see My shining-greatness which You gave Me because You loved Me before the world was made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Holy Father, the world has not known You. I have known You. These have known You sent Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have made Your name known to them and will make it known. So then the love You have for Me may be in them and I may be in them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had said these things, He went with His followers across the small river Kidron. He and His followers went to a garden there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas, who was handing Him over to the leaders, knew the place also. Jesus and His followers had met there many times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas led some soldiers and some men who had been sent by the head religious leaders of the Jews and the proud religious law-keepers to the garden. They carried lamps and sticks that were burning and swords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew what was going to happen to Him. He went out and asked them, “Who are you looking for?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers answered Him, “Jesus of Nazareth.” Jesus said, “I am Jesus.” Judas, who was handing Him over, was with them also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He said to them, “I am Jesus,” they stepped back and fell to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them again, “Who are you looking for?” They said again, “Jesus of Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “I have told you that I am Jesus. If you are looking for Me, let these men go their way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this so the words He spoke might happen, “I have not lost one of those You gave Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter had a sword. He took it and hit a servant who was owned by the head religious leader and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to Peter, “Put your sword back where it belongs. Am I not to go through what My Father has given Me to go through?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers and their captain and the men sent by the Jewish religious leaders took Jesus and tied Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took Him to Annas first. He was the father-in-law of Caiaphas. Caiaphas was the head religious leader that year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caiaphas had talked to the Jews. He told them it would be a good thing if one man should die for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter and another follower came behind Jesus. This other follower was known to the head religious leader. He went with Jesus to the head religious leader’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter stood outside at the gate. The other follower, who was known by the head religious leader, went out and talked to the servant-girl who watched the gate. Then he took Peter inside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant-girl who watched the door said to Peter, “Are you not a follower of this Man?” He said, “I am not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servants who were owned by someone and the soldiers had made a fire because it was cold. They were getting warm by the fire. Peter was standing with them getting warm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The head religious leader of the Jews asked Jesus about His followers. He asked Jesus about His teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “I have spoken very plain words to the world. I have always taught in the Jewish place of worship and in the house of God. It is where the Jews go all the time. My words have not been said in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you ask Me? Ask those who have heard what I said to them. They know what I said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the soldiers standing there hit Jesus with his hand. He said, “Is that how You talk to the head religious leaders?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “If I said anything wrong, tell Me what was wrong. If I said what was right, why did you hit Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Annas sent Jesus to Caiaphas, the head religious leader. Jesus was still tied up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter was standing there and getting warm. They said to him, “Are you not one of His followers also?” He lied and said he did not know Jesus and answered, “I am not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A servant who was owned by the head religious leader was there. He was of the family of the man whose ear Peter cut off. The man said, “Did I not see you in the garden with Him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again Peter lied and said he did not know Jesus. At once a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They led Jesus from Caiaphas into the court room. It was early in the morning. They did not go inside because their Law said if they did they would become dirty with sin. Then they would not be able to eat the religious supper to remember how the Jews left Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate came out to them. He asked, “What have you to say against the Man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews said, “If He had not done wrong, we would not have brought Him to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said to them, “Take Him yourselves and give Him a trial by your Law.” The Jews said to him, “It is against our Law to put anyone to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This happened as Jesus said it would happen. He had told what kind of death He would die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate went back into the court room. He called for Jesus and said to Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Do you ask Me this yourself, or did others say this to you about Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said, “Do you think I am a Jew? Your own people and religious leaders have handed You over to me. What have You done?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “My holy nation does not belong to this world. If My holy nation were of this world, My helpers would fight so I would not be handed over to the Jews. My holy nation is not of this world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to Him, “So You are a King?” Jesus said, “You are right when you say that I am a King. I was born for this reason. I came into the world for this reason. I came to speak about the truth. Everyone who is of the truth hears My voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said to Jesus, “What is truth?” After Pilate said this, he went out again to the Jews. He said, “I do not find Him guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But every year a man who is in prison is allowed to go free at the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. Do you want the King of the Jews to go free?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they spoke with loud voices, “Not this Man, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a robber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate took Jesus and had Him beaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers put a crown of thorns on His head. They put a purple coat on Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “Hello, King of the Jews!” and hit Him with their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate went out again and said to the people, “See, I bring Him out to you so you will know I do not find Him guilty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came out. He had on the crown of thorns and a purple coat. Pilate said to the people, “See! This is the Man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders and the soldiers saw Him. They spoke with loud voices, “Nail Him to a cross! Nail Him to a cross!” Pilate said, “Take Him yourselves and nail Him to a cross. As for me, I do not find Him guilty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jews said to Pilate, “We have a Law that says He should die because He has said He is the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard them say this, he was more afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went into the court room again. He said to Jesus, “Where do You come from?” Jesus did not say a word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said, “Will You not speak to me? Do You not know that I have the right and the power to nail You to a cross? I have the right and the power to let You go free also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “You would not have any right or power over Me if it were not given you from above. For this reason the one who handed Me over to you has the worse sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard this, he wanted to let Jesus go free. But the Jews kept saying, “If you let this Man go free, you are not a friend of Caesar! Whoever makes himself as a king is working against Caesar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard this, he had Jesus brought in front of him. Pilate sat down at the place where men stand in front of him if they are thought to be guilty. The place is called the Stone Floor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the day to get ready for the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. It was about noon. Pilate said to the Jews, “See, your King!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They spoke with a loud voice, “Take Him away! Nail Him to a cross!” Pilate said to them, “Do you want me to nail your King to a cross?” The head religious leaders said, “We have no king but Caesar!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate handed Him over to be nailed to a cross. They took Jesus and led Him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus carried His own cross to a hill called the Place of the Skull.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they nailed Him to the cross. With Him were two others. There was one on each side of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate put a writing on the cross which said, JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was read by many of the Jews. The place where Jesus was nailed to the cross was near the city. The writing was written in the Hebrew and the Latin and the Greek languages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the head religious leaders of the Jews said to Pilate, “Do not write, ‘The King of the Jews’! Write, ‘He said, I am the King of the Jews.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate said, “What I have written is to stay just as it is!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers who nailed Jesus to the cross took His clothes and divided them in four parts, each soldier getting one part. But His coat which was not sewed was made in one piece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to each other, “Let us not cut it up. Let us draw names to see whose it should be.” This happened as the Holy Writings said it would happen, “They divided My clothes among them and they drew names for My coat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the soldiers did.
The mother of Jesus and her sister Mary, the wife of Cleophas, were standing near the cross. Mary Magdalene was there also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw His mother and the follower whom He loved standing near. He said to His mother, “Woman, look at your son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to the follower, “Look at your mother.” From that time the follower took her to his own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew that everything was now finished. Everything happened as the Holy Writings said it would happen. He said, “I am thirsty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a jar full of sour wine near. They filled a sponge and put it on a stick and put it to His mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus took the sour wine and said, “It is finished.” He put His head down and gave up His spirit and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the day before the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt. The next day was the Day of Rest and the great day of the religious gathering. The Jews went to Pilate and asked to have the legs of the men broken. They wanted their bodies taken away so they would not be hanging on the crosses on the Day of Rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first man and of the other one who had been nailed to crosses beside Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Jesus. They saw He was already dead so they did not break His legs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one of the soldiers pushed a spear into His side. Blood and water ran out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who saw it is writing this and what he says is true. He knows he is telling the truth so you may believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things happened as the Holy Writings said they would happen, “Not one of His bones will be broken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in another place the Holy Writings say, “They will look at Him Whose side they cut.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph was from the town of Arimathea. He was a follower of Jesus but was afraid of the Jews. So he worshiped without anyone knowing it. He asked Pilate if he could take away the body of Jesus. Pilate said he could. Then Joseph came and took it away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nicodemus came also. The first time he had come to Jesus had been at night. He brought with him a large box of spices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took the body of Jesus with the spices and put it in linen cloths. This was the way the Jews made a body ready for the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a garden near the place where He had been nailed to the cross. In the garden there was a new grave in the side of the hill. No one had ever been laid there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This place was near by. Because it was the day the Jews got ready for the special religious gathering, they laid Jesus in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the first day of the week. Mary Magdalene came to the grave early in the morning while it was still dark. She saw that the stone had been pushed away from the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She ran to Simon Peter and the other follower whom Jesus loved. She said to them, “They have taken the Lord out of the grave. We do not know where they have put Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter and the other follower went to the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ran but the other follower ran faster than Peter and came to the grave first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He got down and looked in and saw the linen cloths but did not go in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon Peter came and went into the grave. He saw the linen cloths lying there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The white cloth that had been around the head of Jesus was not lying with the other linen cloths. It was rolled up and lying apart by itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the other follower, who had come first, went in also. He saw and believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They still did not understand what the Holy Writings meant when they said that He must rise again from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the followers went back again to their homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary stood outside the grave crying. As she cried, she got down and looked inside the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She saw two angels dressed in white clothes. They were sitting where the body of Jesus had lain. One angel was where His head had lain and one angel was where His feet had lain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to her, “Woman, why are you crying?” She said to them, “Because they have taken away my Lord. I do not know where they have put Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there. But she did not know that it was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to her, “Woman, why are you crying? Who are you looking for?” She thought He was the man who cared for the garden. She said to Him, “Sir, if you have taken Jesus from here, tell me where you have put Him. I will take Him away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Mary!” She turned around and said to Him, “Teacher!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Do not hold on to Me. I have not yet gone up to My Father. But go to My brothers. Tell them that I will go up to My Father and your Father, and to My God and your God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary Magdalene went and told the followers that she had seen the Lord. She told them the things He had said to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was evening of the first day of the week. The followers had gathered together with the doors locked because they were afraid of the Jews. Jesus came and stood among them. He said, “May you have peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had said this, He showed them His hands and His side. When the followers saw the Lord, they were filled with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them again, “May you have peace. As the Father has sent Me, I also am sending you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had said this, He breathed on them. He said, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you say that people are free of sins, they are free of them. If you say that people are not free of sins, they still have them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas was not with them when Jesus came. He was one of the twelve followers and was called the Twin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other followers told him, “We have seen the Lord!” He said to them, “I will not believe until I see the marks made by the nails in His hands. I will not believe until I put my finger into the marks of the nails. I will not believe until I put my hand into His side.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eight days later the followers were again inside a house. Thomas was with them. The doors were locked. Jesus came and stood among them. He said, “May you have peace!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to Thomas, “Put your finger into My hands. Put your hand into My side. Do not doubt, believe!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas said to Him, “My Lord and my God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Thomas, because you have seen Me, you believe. Those are happy who have never seen Me and yet believe!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus did many other powerful works in front of His followers. They are not written in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these are written so you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God. When you put your trust in Him, you will have life that lasts forever through His name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Jesus again showed Himself to His followers at the lake of Tiberias. It happened like this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter and Thomas who was called the Twin and Nathanael from the town of Cana in the country of Galilee and the sons of Zebedee and two other followers were all together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said to them, “I am going fishing.” The others said, “We will go with you.” They went out and got into a boat. That night they caught no fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the morning Jesus stood on the shore of the lake. The followers did not know it was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Children, do you have any fish?” They said, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Put your net over the right side of the boat. Then you will catch some fish.” They put out the net. They were not able to pull it in because it was so full of fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the follower whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” When Peter heard it was the Lord, he put on his fisherman’s coat. (He had taken it off.) Then he jumped into the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other followers came in the boat. They were pulling the net with the fish. They were not far from land, only a little way out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to land they saw fish and bread on a fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish you have just caught.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter went out and pulled the net to land. There were 153 big fish. The net was not broken even with so many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “Come and eat.” Not one of the followers would ask, “Who are You?” They knew it was the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came and took bread and fish and gave it to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the third time Jesus had shown Himself to His followers after He had risen from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were finished eating, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me more than these?” Peter answered Jesus, “Yes, Lord, You know that I love You.” Jesus said to him, “Feed My lambs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to Peter the second time, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me?” He answered Jesus, “Yes, Lord, You know that I love You.” Jesus said to him, “Take care of My sheep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to Peter the third time, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me?” Peter felt bad because Jesus asked him the third time, “Do you love Me?” He answered Jesus, “Lord, You know everything. You know I love You.” Jesus said to him, “Feed My sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For sure, I tell you, when you were young, you put on your belt and went wherever you wanted to go. When you get old, you will put out your hands and someone else will put on your belt and take you away where you do not want to go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this to tell Peter what kind of death he would die to honor God. After Jesus said this, He said to Peter, “Follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter turned around. He saw the follower whom Jesus loved, following. This one had been beside Jesus at the supper. This is the one who had asked Jesus, “Lord, who will hand You over?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter saw him and said to Jesus, “But Lord, what about this one?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “If I want this one to wait until I come, what is that to you? You follow Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the news spread among the followers that this follower would not die. But Jesus did not say to him that he would not die. He said, “If I want him to wait until I come, what is that to you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the follower who is telling of these things and who has written them. We know that his word is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are many other things which Jesus did also. If they were all written down, I do not think the world itself could hold the books that would be written.
verses.speaker: Narrator
